ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

Approximately how frequently did you use any of the previous medications in the 3 months prior to becoming pregnant? (Only asked of folks who endorse any past 3-month use.)
Notes: 1 = 1 or 2 times; 2 = Once a month; 3 = Two to three times a month; 4 = Once a week; 5 = A few times per week; 6 = Once a day; 7 = 2 to 4 times a day; 8 = 5 to 9 times a day; 9 = 10 or more times a day

ElementDescription: By what means did you obtain these medications (thinking of only those you took in the 3 months before becoming pregnant)?
Notes: 0 = Doctor's prescription; 1 = Source other than doctor's prescription; 2 = Both

ElementDescription: In the 3 months before becoming pregnant, how often did you have to go to someone other than a prescribing physician to get sufficient pain relief? (i.e., multiple doctors, the Emergency Room, friends, street sources)
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often; 5 = Never needed the medication for pain

ElementDescription: In the 3 months before becoming pregnant, how often did you take your medications differently from how they were prescribed?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often; 5 = They were never prescribed to me

ElementDescription: In the 3 months before becoming pregnant, how often did you need to take pain medications belonging to someone else?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often

ElementDescription: In the 3 months before becoming pregnant, how often were you worried about how you were handling these medications?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often

ElementDescription: In the 3 months before becoming pregnant, how often were other people worried about how you were handling these medications?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often

ElementDescription: In the 3 months before becoming pregnant, how often did you have to make an emergency phone call or show up at the clinic without an appointment (to obtain more medication)?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often

ElementDescription: In the 3 months before becoming pregnant, how often did you take more of your medication than prescribed?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often; 5 = They were never prescribed to me

ElementDescription: In the 3 months before becoming pregnant, how often did you borrow pain medication from someone else?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often

ElementDescription: In the 3 months before becoming pregnant, how often did you use these medicines for something other than for pain (e.g., to help you sleep, improve your mood, or relieve stress)?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often
